intro: Chirita integra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its leaves are often velvety and dark green, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Chirita integra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
